content.description: Go up the crack to the overhang on the left side of the east face. As you near the top look out for birds and thorny plants.  I found numerous skeletons of dead animals so depending on the time of year you might have to contend with wild creatures for a good spot to belay from.
content.protection: There are plenty of places to use smaller nuts and cams.
content.location: We lowered off the south face, where Couch Potato should be, and the last guy down climbed the 5.4 (Couch Potato). If you arn't too excited about that down climb, you could probabily find a better way around to the west or find a way to rap off.

content.description: Easy climbing on the left side of the tower is the way to set up a top rope.  Not really worth doing except to TR other routes.  No anchor at the top of the tower so you may want to downclimb this to get off.
If memory serves, there was a small flat rock near the cliff. This led us to believe we were at Table Rock but the 'table' here was much smaller and closer to the cliff face.
